key_terms.term_description: Rate on Line (ROL) for all three layers (18%, 12%, 8%)
key_terms.rationale: The proposed rates are at or above the high end of current market benchmarks (16-19%, 10-13%, 7-9% respectively) as indicated in the market conditions report.

key_terms.term_description: Exclusion for named storms that have entered the Gulf of Mexico prior to attachment
key_terms.rationale: This is a new exclusion that significantly reduces coverage, especially problematic given the cedent's 30% exposure in the Southeast region.

key_terms.term_description: Two free reinstatements for Layer 1, one reinstatement at 100% for Layer 2, one at 125% for Layer 3
key_terms.rationale: The counterparty email indicates this is a reduction from unlimited reinstatements for Layer 1, and the reinstatement premium for Layer 3 (125%) is particularly high.

key_terms.term_description: Limitation on increasing exposure in high-risk zones by more than 15% without prior notification
key_terms.rationale: This restricts business growth in potentially profitable areas and adds administrative burden of notification requirements.

key_terms.term_description: 36-month reporting limitation for losses occurring prior to treaty expiration
key_terms.rationale: While the market report indicates this is becoming standard, it creates potential coverage gaps for late-developing claims.

market_comparison.layer1_assessment: Above market - 18% ROL vs market benchmark of 16-19%
market_comparison.layer2_assessment: Above market - 12% ROL vs market benchmark of 10-13%
market_comparison.layer3_assessment: Above market - 8% ROL vs market benchmark of 7-9%

pros: Increased limit in Layer 1 ($15M vs $10M) provides more coverage where most historical losses occur
Lower ROL in Layer 2 (10% vs 12%) and Layer 3 (7% vs 8%) compared to proposed structure
cons: Reduced total limit ($50M in proposed vs $45M in Alternative 1)

pros: Lower ROL across all layers compared to proposed structure
cons: Higher attachment point for Layer 1 ($7.5M vs $5M) would reduce recoveries
Total limit of $52.5M is similar to proposed structure but with less favorable distribution

pros: Three free reinstatements for Layer 1 (vs two in proposed structure)
Lower reinstatement premium for Layer 2 (75% vs 100%)

gulf_exclusion.target: Complete removal of the Gulf of Mexico named storm exclusion
gulf_exclusion.minimum: Modified exclusion that only applies to named storms of Category 3 or higher that have been in the Gulf for more than 48 hours

premium_rates.target: Layer 1: 16%, Layer 2: 10%, Layer 3: 7% (lower end of market benchmarks)
premium_rates.minimum: Layer 1: 17%, Layer 2: 11%, Layer 3: 7.5% (middle of market benchmarks)

reinstatements.target: Three free reinstatements for Layer 1, one reinstatement at 75% for Layer 2, one at 100% for Layer 3
reinstatements.minimum: Two free reinstatements for Layer 1, one reinstatement at 100% for Layer 2, one at 100% for Layer 3

portfolio_protection.target: Increase the exposure growth limitation to 25% without prior notification
portfolio_protection.minimum: Increase the exposure growth limitation to 20% with 15-day notification period

concessions.concession_item: Accept the 36-month sunset clause if other key terms are improved
concessions.rationale: The market report indicates this is becoming standard, and historical data suggests most claims are reported within this timeframe.
This is administratively manageable and demonstrates transparency with the reinsurer.

concessions.concession_item: Accept the proposed claims notification period of 30 days
concessions.rationale: This is already an improvement from the previous 14-day period and is operationally sufficient.

key_points: Acknowledge the challenging market conditions while emphasizing our strong historical relationship
Highlight our improved catastrophe modeling and risk management practices
Address their concerns about Southeast exposure concentration
Emphasize the need for appropriate coverage given our historical loss patterns
Express appreciation for the extended claims notification period

proposed_modifications.current_language: Losses from named storms that have entered the Gulf of Mexico prior to attachment
proposed_modifications.proposed_language: Losses from named storms of Category 4 or higher that have been in the Gulf of Mexico for more than 72 hours prior to making landfall
proposed_modifications.justification: The current exclusion is overly broad and would have excluded significant portions of our historical hurricane losses. Our analysis shows that the proposed narrower exclusion would still provide reinsurers protection against the most severe events while maintaining essential coverage for our portfolio.

proposed_modifications.current_language: Layer 1: 18% Rate on Line (ROL), Layer 2: 12% ROL, Layer 3: 8% ROL
proposed_modifications.proposed_language: Layer 1: 17% Rate on Line (ROL), Layer 2: 11% ROL, Layer 3: 7.5% ROL
proposed_modifications.justification: The proposed rates are at the high end of current market benchmarks. Our loss history, while showing two significant events in 2020 and 2022, has otherwise been stable. The proposed adjusted rates remain within market ranges while better reflecting our risk profile.

proposed_modifications.current_language: Layer 1: Two free reinstatements, Layer 2: One reinstatement at 100% of pro-rata premium, Layer 3: One reinstatement at 125% of pro-rata premium
proposed_modifications.proposed_language: Layer 1: Three free reinstatements, Layer 2: One reinstatement at 100% of pro-rata premium, Layer 3: One reinstatement at 100% of pro-rata premium
proposed_modifications.justification: Historical data shows frequent utilization of Layer 1, making additional reinstatements valuable. The 125% reinstatement premium for Layer 3 is above market norms and should be reduced to 100%, which is standard according to the market report.

proposed_modifications.current_language: The Cedent agrees not to increase exposure in high-risk zones by more than 15% without prior notification to the Reinsurer.
proposed_modifications.proposed_language: The Cedent agrees not to increase exposure in high-risk zones by more than 20% without prior notification to the Reinsurer.
proposed_modifications.justification: The 15% growth limitation is overly restrictive for our business plans. A 20% threshold provides us necessary flexibility while still giving the reinsurer visibility into significant exposure changes.
